text:
hey everyone so this is an add-on video to my dry 
Tom yum recipe I want to show you how I prep and

clean my squid I am by no means an expert at 
cleaning squid but I just wanted to make this

available to you so that if you've never done it 
before you don't have to look any further okay so

let's get started the first thing we're gonna do 
is gonna separate the head and the body so I just

pull that out and your squid may be in better 
condition than mine and so be kind of careful

because the ink sac is right here and if you want 
to save it then you want to be careful that you

don't rupture that but if you don't care then just 
whatever okay and then we're just gonna pull that

off so this is the guts which we will not a which 
we will not eat not for this recipe anyway we're

going to eat everything under the eye or above the 
eye however where you want to look at it so I'm

just gonna take my knife and cut right under here 
so there this you can throw away or save the ink

sack if you wish with this squid is gonna have to 
really really really long tentacles which you can

eat some people throw them away but it's edible 
so you want to save that so with the tentacles

in the middle there's actually a hard piece here 
that's the mouth of the squid so you want to get

rid of that you can feel it with your hand it'll 
be pretty hard I should be able to pull that off

and then because this is really big I don't want 
to serve the squid with the with the whole set of

tentacles I'm just gonna separate it and cut them 
into like 2 or 1 or whatever whatever you want to

do from here oh look it's like a Hawaiian skirt 
so let's say we'll do two tentacles cuz those

are pretty small that's a big one so so those are 
the 10 that goes so with the body you first want

to remove what they call the quill which is this 
hard shell inside and I can pull this out but mine

is broken so there's still another one inside 
here I can feel it if yours comes out in one

nice big piece good for you that doesn't happen 
with me so because I'm gonna cut this squid in

anyway I'll just pull that out when I get to it 
the second thing I want to do is peel off the

skin so this purple skin is it edible yeah it's 
edible but it's gonna kind of turn when you cook

it it's it doesn't look very good I don't know 
if this is true but I think on bigger squid it

can be a little chewy as well and you just kind 
of like get a grip on it and just pull the whole

thing right off it's very satisfying so much fun 
to peel off the skin and you can buy squid that's

already been clean and prepped for you and you can 
skip this whole thing altogether okay so now with

the wings these wings on the squid when you try 
to peel the skin you can just peel the the wings

right off of the squid the wings are edible but 
you can deal with that separately right here so

I can feel I have a quill right here so I'll cut 
right here so I can remove the other half of my

quill see and I'm gonna give these a quick rinse 
because it's kind of slimy and gross right now and

then on the inside they're all these like little 
membranes that I'm gonna try to pull out as well

yeah pull as much as you can out it's not a big 
deal you don't have to get it Barclays sparkly

clean now you just cut this however you want so 
for our purposes I'm gonna do ring squids shrink

quite a bit when you cook them so cut them a 
little bit bigger than you want them to be at

the end and if as you cut you still find some 
remaining membrane that you didn't take out you

can pull that out right now if you don't remove 
the membranes when you cook it the membranes will

sort of like stretch out and and sort of be like 
a web in the middle of the Rings they're edible

it just doesn't look very good okay now with the 
wings I'm just gonna try to peel the skin off so

much fun as much as you can like once you get to 
like this type of thing don't worry about it you

just don't want big large patches of skin and then 
with this just cut it however you like so let's

just do pieces like that and don't forget those 
extra long tentacles you can just cut these up

and throw them in as well and that is it it's done 
it's not that hard it's just a little slimy messy

if you somehow got here without going through my 
dry tom yum recipe check out that recipe I will

link to it in the description box below thank you 
very much for watching and I'll see you next time
